metadata.title: Logic Apps Custom Connector - Cisco Meraki
metadata.description: This custom connector connects to Cisco Meraki Dashboard API service endpoint and programmatically manages and monitors Meraki networks at scale.
prerequisites: Cisco Meraki Dashboard API service endpoint should be known.
metadata.comments: This custom connector connects to Cisco Meraki Dashboard API service endpoint and programmatically manages and monitors Meraki networks at scale.

metadata.description: Enter the name for Cisco Meraki custom connector without spaces
Enter the API KEY for Cisco Meraki Dashboard API Service End
Enter the Cisco Meraki Dashboard API Service End Point as 'https://{CiscoMerakiDomain}/api/{VersionNumber}'

uiDefinition.description: The API Key for this api

properties.description: Cisco Meraki custom connector connects to Meraki Dashboard API service endpoint and programmatically manages and monitors Meraki networks at scale.

info.title: Meraki Dashboard API
info.description: Cisco Meraki custom connector connects to Meraki Dashboard API service endpoint and programmatically manages and monitors Meraki networks at scale.

get.description: List the organizations that the user has privileges on
List the networks that the user has privileges on in an organization

parameters.name: configTemplateId
parameters.description: An optional parameter that is the ID of a config template. Will return all networks bound to that template.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An optional parameter to filter networks by tags. The filtering is case-sensitive. If tags are included tagsFilterType should also be included.

parameters.name: tagsFilterType
parameters.description: An optional parameter of value withAnyTags or withAllTags to indicate whether to return networks which contain ANY or ALL of the included tags. If no type is included withAnyTags will be selected.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 100000.

parameters.name: startingAfter
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first last prev or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: endingBefore
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first last prev or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

get.description: List the devices in a network
List the clients that have used this network in the timespan

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan do not specify parameter t0. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000.

parameters.name: startingAfter
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first last prev or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

parameters.name: endingBefore
parameters.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first last prev or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

get.description: Return the content filtering settings for an MX network

put.description: Update the content filtering settings for an MX network

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type of the request

allowedUrlPatterns.description: A list of URL patterns that are allowed
allowedUrlPatterns.title: Allowed URL Patterns

blockedUrlPatterns.description: A list of URL patterns that are blocked
blockedUrlPatterns.title: Blocked URL Patterns

blockedUrlCategories.description: A list of URL categories to block
blockedUrlCategories.title: Blocked URL Categories

urlCategoryListSize.description: URL category list size (topSites or fullList)
urlCategoryListSize.title: URL Category List Size

get.summary: Get Network Appliance Firewall L3 Firewall Rules
get.description: Return the L3 firewall rules for an MX network

put.description: Update the L3 firewall rules of an MX network
put.summary: Update Network Appliance L3 Firewall Rules

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The Content Type of the request

policy.description: allow or deny traffic specified by the rule
policy.title: Policy

protocol.description: The type of protocol (tcp, udp, icmp or any)
protocol.title: Protocol

destPort.description: Comma-separated list of destination port(s) (integer in the range 1-65535) or any
destPort.title: Destination Port

destCidr.description: Comma-separated list of destination IP address(es) (in IP or CIDR notation) fully-qualified domain names (FQDN) or any
destCidr.title: Destination IP Address

srcPort.description: Comma-separated list of source IP address(es) (in IP or CIDR notation) or any (FQDN not supported for source addresses)
srcPort.title: Source Port

srcCidr.description: Comma-separated list of source port(s) (integer in the range 1-65535) or any
srcCidr.title: Source IP Address

syslogEnabled.description: Log this rule to syslog (true or false - boolean value) - only applicable if a syslog has been configured
syslogEnabled.title: Syslog Enabled

get.description: List the MX L7 firewall rules for an MX network
get.summary: Get Network Appliance Firewall L7 Firewall Rules

put.summary: Update Network Appliance Firewall L7 Firewall Rules
put.description: Update the MX L7 firewall rules for an MX network

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type of the request

type.description: Type of the L7 rule (application, applicationCategory, host, port, ipRange)
type.title: Type

value.description: The value of what you want to block. Format of value varies depending on type of the rule.
value.title: Value

rules.description: An ordered array of the MX L7 firewall rules
rules.title: Rules

get.description: Return the policy assigned to a client on the network. Clients can be identified by a client key or either the MAC or IP depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP.

put.description: Update the policy assigned to a client on the network. Clients can be identified by a client key or either the MAC or IP depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type of the request

devicePolicy.description: The policy to assign (Whitelisted, Blocked, Normal, Group policy)
devicePolicy.title: Device Policy

groupPolicyId.description: If devicePolicy is set to Group policy this param is used to specify the group policy ID
groupPolicyId.title: Group Policy Id

get.description: List the group policies in a network
Display a group policy on the network
